text:
Hey everyone,

Just following up on my previous post regarding the issue with tracking Google and Facebook leads after the recent API shift. We haven't received any feedback yet and would really appreciate your insights or suggestions on how to resolve this. Has anyone else faced similar issues or found a workaround?

Also, is there a *Discord* community for HubSpot? If so, please let us know.

Thanks in advance for your help!

:wave: Hello, team!
I’m looking for guidance on how to use a Template(Library/Templates) to send emails from the API.
Could you please provide some insights or resources on this?
Thank you!

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/marketing-email/how-to-use-transactional-email-in-HubSpot|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/marketing-email/how-to-use-transactional-email-in-HubSpot>
You need an add on to do so, or use your own SMTP server I would say.

<@U033VNNBBBP> Thanks for your guidance!

Could you please advise on how to utilize the Library Template within Marketing email templates?
ah gotcha, yeah the transactional email has a 600/month add on you need, that's why I just wanted to double check you had the marketing single send endpoint docs

Hello, I am using .net web api to create/update a group of contacts(POST /contacts/v1/contact/batch/). When I make a request I get "Accepted" back but the contact I am trying to update doesnot get updated. Here is the logs with request ID.

"Accepted" is an http 202 status response,
which generally mean successfully accepted for processing but might have completed processing (and no guarantees that that processing is successful)
This is common for asyncronous jobs where your code doesn't get blocked waiting to the processing to finish.
<https://restfulapi.net/http-status-202-accepted/>
<@U07PS3Y89BL> Thanks for the reply..How do I look at the error if there is any when I do batch post?
Does anybody know if the oauth grant type uses PKSE?

Hi All,
Is there any API that I can use to get object properties for a specific property group.
Hey Ryan, Thanks for the help. Though my need is I want to get the contact properties on the basis of a groupName whereas this API returns me the different property groups for a particular object.
Use this and filter the reponse using   groupName

This endpoint returns

```{
  "results": [
    {
      "createdUserId": "string",
      "hidden": false,
      "modificationMetadata": {
        "readOnlyOptions": true,
        "readOnlyValue": true,
        "readOnlyDefinition": true,
        "archivable": true
      },
      "displayOrder": 2,
      "description": "string",
      "showCurrencySymbol": true,
      "label": "My Contact Property",
      "type": "enumeration",
      "HubSpotDefined": true,
      "formField": true,
      "createdAt": "2024-10-22T05:03:14.433Z",
      "archivedAt": "2024-10-22T05:03:14.433Z",
      "archived": true,
      "groupName": "contactinformation",
      "referencedObjectType": "string",
      "name": "my_contact_property",
      "options": [
        {
          "hidden": false,
          "displayOrder": 1,
          "description": "Choice number one",
          "label": "Option A",
          "value": "A"
        }
      ],
      "calculationFormula": "string",
      "hasUniqueValue": false,
      "fieldType": "select",
      "updatedUserId": "string",
      "calculated": true,
      "externalOptions": true,
      "updatedAt": "2024-10-22T05:03:14.433Z"
    }
  ]
}```
Yes, right, I think this is the only way to make it work. I was looking for an API which did that already :face_holding_back_tears:  But yeah, let me just use it only. Thankyou!!  :simple_smile:
